header_summary:
Bitcoin development sees a significant innovation with the introduction of Octojoin, a method designed to enhance transaction privacy by making it difficult for on-chain analysis to separate individual contributions within a transaction. Inspired by an octopus's camouflage ability, Octojoin aims to integrate seamlessly with standard Bitcoin transactions, thereby improving anonymity. This approach not only bolsters privacy but also promotes the use of swaps and the selling of statecoins derived from coinjoined UTXOs, highlighting a strategic move towards more private and versatile Bitcoin transactions. More details can be explored on the [Octojoin official webpage](https://octojoin.com).

The latest Bitcoin Core version 26.2 release encompasses a suite of updates aimed at refining the platform's functionality and user experience. Key enhancements include performance improvements, bug fixes, and updated translations to support a wider user base globally. The update, which is accessible via direct download or BitTorrent, reflects a concerted effort by the Bitcoin community and contributors to maintain the software’s compatibility across various operating systems while introducing significant changes in script handling and network protocols. Users are encouraged to report issues on the [GitHub issue tracker](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues) and stay informed through the mailing list.

In cryptographic research, the introduction of the LS-LSAG ring signature scheme marks a notable advancement in blockchain technology, offering a shift from linear to logarithmic signature sizes. This efficiency leap, detailed in a draft open for community feedback, promises enhanced privacy and system compatibility without requiring a trusted setup. The LS-LSAG's innovative approach, relying on discrete logarithm assumptions and hash-to-curve function collision resistance, exemplifies the ongoing quest for improving cryptographic techniques within the blockchain domain, ensuring secure and efficient transactions.

recent_posts.title: Octojoin: Payjoin with no interaction between sender and recipient
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin developers are addressing privacy challenges using Payjoin and Octojoin transactions.
- Octojoin enhances privacy by mixing inputs, making tracking by analysts difficult.
- It also promotes swap usage and allows selling of statecoins from coinjoined UTXOs.

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core 26.2 released
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core version 26.2 is now available for download, offering new features and bug fixes.
- Upgrading requires shutting down older versions, with specific installation instructions for different OS.
- Significant updates include script handling adjustments and networking changes, thanking contributors for their efforts.

recent_posts.title: A new logarithmic-size signature scheme LS-LSAG
recent_posts.summary:
- Ed Hughes introduced a new ring signature, LS-LSAG, for blockchain improvements.
- LS-LSAG offers log-size efficiency and compatibility with Curve Trees in cryptography.
- It ensures unforgeability through the Discrete Logarithm principle and hash-to-curve security.

active_posts.title: Proposing a P2QRH BIP towards a quantum resistant soft fork
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal outlines adding quantum resistance to Bitcoin with a new signature algorithm.
- It highlights the importance of rapid action against quantum computing threats to Bitcoin's security.
- The document calls for community feedback on the "QuBit" soft fork initiative for future protection.

active_posts.title: Idea for BIP : Deterministic Wallets with Token support
active_posts.summary:
- The need for HD wallet structure revision is highlighted by Ethereum's token diversification.
- Proposed solutions include utilizing unique token identifiers for generating distinct keys.
- Innovations improve transaction privacy and simplify managing multiple tokens in a single wallet.

active_posts.title: Public disclosure of 10 vulnerabilities affecting Bitcoin Core < 0.21.0
active_posts.summary:
- The project launched a new vulnerability disclosure policy to boost security.
- It plans to release details of fixed vulnerabilities, starting with version 22.0 in July.
- This transparent approach aims to protect the community and stakeholders.

active_posts.title: Is it time to increase the blocksize cap?
active_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin's practicality for daily transactions is challenged by rising fees and scalability issues.
- The debate on Bitcoin's user base questions if its core should serve big entities, affecting autonomy.
- The author criticizes Bitcoin's governance and deviation from its original free-market principles, advocating for its realignment with individual liberty.

active_posts.title: Stable Channels - peer-to-peer dollar balances on Lightning
active_posts.summary:
- Stable Channels integrates bitcoin-backed dollar balances with the Lightning network to enhance bitcoin stability.
- The project minimizes counterparty risk and price volatility without needing banks or fiat, aiming for decentralized financial stability.
- It faces user experience and operational challenges, yet opens new possibilities for trading and liquidity on the Lightning Network.

active_posts.title: Introduction to cluster linearization
active_posts.summary:
- Cluster linearization aims to improve Bitcoin Core efficiency by organizing transactions into clusters.
- It enhances transaction relay, block validation, and fee estimation through structured transaction management.
- Efforts to integrate this approach in Bitcoin Core demonstrate advancement in blockchain scalability and performance.

today_in_history_posts.title: BIP 118 and SIGHASH_ANYPREVOUT
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- ZmnSCPxj proposed a Taproot version of eltoo, using a shared MuSig pubkey for channels.
- Update transactions use `SIGHASH_ANYPREVOUTANYSCRIPT`, and state transactions use `SIGHASH_ANYPREVOUT`.
- Richard Myers inquired about key-path versus script-path spending and efficiency of signing processes.

today_in_history_posts.title: Dynamic Commitments: Upgrading Channels Without On-Chain Transactions
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Rusty Russell proposes adding `commit_switch` and `commit_switch_reply` for double-opt-in.
- He suggests keeping the initiator system to avoid collisions and prefers linear channel type progression.
- Upgrades involve feature matching and a three-step approach to adopting anchor_outputs, questioning current work on a feature bit.

today_in_history_posts.title: Thoughts on scaling and consensus changes (2023)
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin scalability involves creating 50,000 off-chain "bitcoin banks" for wider transaction capacity.
- Concepts like Utreexo and `OP_VAULT` aim to optimize storage and increase security without centralizing Bitcoin.
- Effective Layer 2 protocols and off-chain entity networking are essential for regulatory compliance and Bitcoin's growth.
